The bed was quite comfy, and the keyless entry made check-in and access a breeze.

review_text:
We enjoyed Steph's property during our stay for a family member's wedding in Celina. Apparently, the property is an old mansion built in 1908, separated into multiple apartment units and common spaces. We stayed in Apt #3. Although the property is being renovated, we were not at all disturbed. What has been renovated looks amazing, with modern features. The apartment was decorated extremely well, and we were pleasantly surprised by the architectural features and abundance of space. Our 12 yo son loved the TV consoles with electric fireplaces in every bedroom -- what a fantastic choice! The trendy gray/white color palette was perfect, and the beds were comfy. AC is via window units with remote controls, but they worked extremely well and kept us cool without problem. I couldn't tell if the property still relied on radiator heat, but there was a radiator in nearly every room, which does date the space a tad; we hardly noticed them, though. We appreciated the color-coordinated baskets in each room, which we used for dirty clothes before replacing with our linens when we left. Steph left a bottle of wine, sodas, waters, and snacks out for us, which was a nice touch. Just note that the wine is red but sweet. There was a well-appointed laundry room and a lobby of sorts, as well. The location was central to everywhere we needed to go. This really was a great space!
There were a few things missing that would have made the experience better and more convenient: A coffeemaker and an iron on premises, although there was an ironing board. To us, these amenities are standard, but going back to the listing, I saw that they are not listed. Such an easy thing to overlook when making a booking because these amenities are rather standard across Airbnbs and hotels, at least in the US. Hopefully, Steph makes the small investment to provide those for future guests. Also, the entry hall is extremely dark at night (and a bit spooky, especially with doors that have no door knobs). Again, the space is being renovated. We left the light on once when we were away at night, but we thought that a hall light with motion-sensor would be better.
Overall, we would happily stay at this property again! Our friends and family in the area had no idea that the property existed, but we raved on about it and recommended they consider this option when they have family come to town. Once we confirm our holiday plans, we'll be sure to look to this listing for availability. Thanks for a wonderful stay, Steph!
